entry.et: Middle English, from Old English scilling; akin to Old High German skilling, a gold coin

def.dt: :a former monetary unit of the United Kingdom equal to 12 pence or 1/20 pound
:a former monetary unit equal to 1/20 pound of any of various countries in or formerly in the Commonwealth of Nations
:to act as a spokesperson or promoter the eminent Shakespearean producer … is now shilling for a brokerage house Andy Rooney
